channel.title: Bulletstorm
channel.description:
I just played the PS3 demo and god damn, it's fun as all kinds of fuck.
The demo level is really short and there aren't many enemies in it, but you can replay it dozens of times until you find all the skillshots and improve your final score.
I'm definitely getting this one for PC.

item.title: Bulletstorm
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
I know, the point was when you hit the ground it’s not very useful anymore.

Read full topic

item.title: Bulletstorm
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
Eh, with Battlefield, jumping has been around since the series started, it’s always been part of the whole almost Just Cause-esque pulling a parachute out of your ass sort of thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Bulletstorm
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
CTID:

I don’t ever remember Killzone having jump, to be honest. But I assume it did, or you wouldn’t have said anything.

Well, Killzone 2 at least.

COD or Battlefield or l4d (for the most part) are other acceptable examples.

Read full topic

item.title: Bulletstorm
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
Winged One:

That big Godzilla type monster was the first time in a shooter that I said “FUCK THAT THING IS HUGE”.

though at times the fact your hand is always held gets annoying.

I agree with both of these points.

Sorrano pissed me off, though. He was annoying as hell.

Read full topic

item.title: Bulletstorm
item.dc:creator: Winged_One
item.description:
Ghost page :fffuuu:

But yeah, this game was awesome. I was thinking of new ways to kill someone while a giant creature stombed around knocking over buildings. There was just a scene on an epic scale every time I turned the corner. That big Godzilla type monster was the first time in a shooter that I said “FUCK THAT THING IS HUGE”.

And most of the lines were funny as hell, especially Sarrano’s lines…that guy makes cussing and being a pretentious cock an art form.

EDIT: though at times the fact your hand is always held gets annoying.

Read full topic

item.title: Bulletstorm
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
What would you do with it?

Come to think of it, there are quite a lot of shooters with fucking useless jumps that could use the A/X button for something more useful (slide/roll) in their context.

Like Killzone.

Read full topic

item.title: Bulletstorm
item.dc:creator: Piefish
item.description:
Maverix26:

That actually wasn’t was I was referring to, piefish.

Being an asshole doesnt make you cool, you know…
Anyways, ill post a screened of the ACTUAL portal reference when I get home(:

It does on the internet…

Also Yahtzee’s review was okay…there’s a lot of stuff he didn’t cover though

Read full topic

item.title: Bulletstorm
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
He overstates the negative elements of games like crazy, but he nevertheless has valid reasons why he considers game bad, and interesting ideas about the game industry. Bulletstorm is a good example of this. I never really thought of it, but it is an unholy blend of old fast paced gameplay with modern slow tedious cover based shooting, and it fails miserably because of it. And the million other issues it has.

Read full topic

item.title: Bulletstorm
item.dc:creator: CTID
item.description:
Yes, he does. But I didn’t think people actually cared what he thought of games. I know I don’t, I watch his videos because I think he’s hilarious.

Read full topic

item.title: Bulletstorm
item.dc:creator: Piefish
item.description:
Maverix26:

Everywhere! They’res a bunch of the portal logos (the one with the little guy falling through a portal with an arrow under him) they’res even the portal 2 logo (with the guy walking through the portal)

ZOMG!!!1 A PORTAL REFERENCE HERPY DERP!!!

They were not portal references they were just your bog standard exit signs.

Also the Theme Song is damn epic, sounds like Steve Jablonsky did it ::awesome:

Edit: Also just found this https://www.escapistmagazine.com/forums/read/7.266620-Bulletstorm-Dev-Honors-Yahtzee-With-Priceless-Gift?page=1
Wonder what Yahtzee will make of the game now
